questions.question: What key new feature, besides expanded web real estate, was included in the January 23, 2026 update to Neynar Studio?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak stated the update included secure configuration of Environment Variables & secrets, file browsing, and faster dev containers.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak attributed the rapid improvement of their bot to visibility into what process?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak stated on 2026-01-21 that 'tool call visibility helps us improve the bot faster'.

questions.question: Which specific teams/individuals did Jesse Pollak thank for originally making Farcaster what it is, before discussing the shift to building the protocol itself?
options: @dwr, @v, and the amazing team at Merkle
The Base core team and Vitalik Buterin
questions.explanation: JP thanked '@dwr, @v, and the amazing team at Merkle' for their foundational work.

questions.question: Which specific AI platforms did Jesse Pollak suggest had superior distribution compared to people 'discovering / trying Claude and other Anthropic products this late'?
questions.explanation: JP noted that the late adoption of Claude 'puts the ChatGPT and Gemini distribution into perspective.'

questions.question: Which components were explicitly stated NOT to be impacted by the authentication, user management, and team management upgrades causing minor downtime on dev.neynar.com?
options: Neynar App Studio and Mini App charts
questions.explanation: The post explicitly stated: 'API, webhooks and other products will not be impacted'.

questions.question: Which US exchange did Jesse Pollak report as having the lowest noted market order spread on BTC/USD or BTC/USDC pairs, at 0.85%?
questions.explanation: JP listed Coinbase Advanced at 1% and Robinhood at 0.85%.

questions.question: What product component was described as being 'made for the bots, curated by the humans at neynar'?
questions.explanation: The post referenced '@neynar/ui was made for the bots, curated by the humans at neynar'.

questions.question: What development experience improvement did Neynar implement for the Node.js SDK documentation on January 2nd, 2026?
options: Integrated video tutorials for every function
questions.explanation: JP stated: 'We automated publishing documentation for our Node.js SDK.'

questions.question: What specific user experience was JP seeking to simplify by improving webhook filter configuration (leading to natural language capabilities via an App Studio agent)?
options: Figuring out what parent URL, parent hash, and other technical terms might mean
Connecting to the correct OP Mainnet RPC endpoint
Managing team access levels on the dashboard
questions.explanation: The simplification aimed to 'Skip figuring out what parent URL, parent hash, and other technical terms might mean.'

questions.question: In the context of prediction markets, what action did Jesse Pollak state he wanted to perform, rather than making or betting on them?
questions.explanation: JP stated: 'everyone wants to make or bet on prediction markets. i want to resolve them.'

questions.question: According to the Anthropic report cited by Jesse Pollak, what percentage of blockchain vulnerabilities in the post-March 2025 benchmark were exploited by AI agents?
questions.explanation: The citation noted agents 'have gone from exploiting 2% of vulnerabilities... to 55.88%'

questions.question: What direction did Jesse Pollak indicate for Farcaster infrastructure development following the statement, 'We read a chain now'?
options: We write to a chain next
questions.explanation: JP's post: 'We read a chain now, we write to a chain next.'

questions.question: In March 2024, the official Base account posted about doubling which key metric 'last week'?
questions.explanation: The post stated: 'last week we doubled our revenue and I have no idea why.'

questions.question: Dan Romero offered a $100 bounty for the fewest lines of code script that could send what specific cast directly to Snapchain?
questions.explanation: The bounty was for a 'Fewest lines of code script that can send a 'gm' cast directly to Snapchain.'

questions.question: What was the specified deadline for Dan Romero's Snapchain 'gm' cast script bounty?
questions.explanation: The post listed: 'Deadline: Fri Jan 23 at 1pm PT'

questions.question: What specific issue did Dan Romero encounter regarding the `SignedKeyRequestValidator` address while debugging with Claude Code?
options: Rate limiting due to excessive calls
questions.explanation: DR noted: 'viem rejected the SignedKeyRequestValidator address due to incorrect mixed-case checksum (Fa vs fA)' related to EIP-55.

questions.question: After closing a fundraising round in November 2023, what was the first role the Coinbase account stated they were hiring for?
questions.explanation: Coinbase stated: 'the first role we're hiring for is a product designer.'

questions.question: Dan Romero found that the `KeyGateway` expected metadata to be encoded in what specific format?
options: As a tuple (struct with 0x20 offset prefix)
questions.explanation: DR noted: 'KeyGateway expects metadata encoded as a tuple (struct with 0x20 offset prefix), not flat parameters.'

questions.question: In his debugging notes, Dan Romero found that the official gRPC endpoint (crackle:3383) required a password, but which specific service/port appeared publicly accessible?
options: The plain HTTP API on port 80
The HTTPS HTTP API on port 3381
The Bootstrap node IPs on port 8080
questions.explanation: DR stated: 'Only the HTTPS HTTP API on port 3381 appears publicly accessible.'

questions.question: Dan Romero mentioned using ChatGPT to help him navigate which common business/HR platform by feeding it screenshots of the page?
questions.explanation: DR stated: 'Any time I need to do something in Rippling I just take a screenshot of the page, feed into ChatGPT and ask what to do next.'

questions.question: What specific documentation detail did Dan Romero mention was missing, causing him to debug the `validate` function ABI mismatch?
options: The exact contract source on Etherscan
The correct number of arguments (3, not 5)
The proper encoding for the mnemonic
questions.explanation: DR noted: 'validate was initially called with 5 arguments; actual signature takes 3.' and debugging required reading contract source.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong used which Neynar product to create his 'Check out my top besties on Farcaster!' cast?
questions.explanation: The post included the tagline: '‚òùÔ∏è created with @neynar app studio'

questions.question: When debugging Farcaster transaction broadcasting, Dan Romero noted he had the mnemonic but was missing which component needed for acquiring OP Mainnet ETH?
options: A free RPC to broadcast transaction
questions.explanation: DR stated: 'I had mnemonic but no signer. So needed to get OP Mainnet ETH. 2. No free RPC to broadcast transaction.'

questions.question: What was the primary purpose of the `improvements.md` file format Dan Romero suggested generating after an AI coding session?
options: Tracking feature requests for the AI model
Listing every time the API docs were unclear/incorrect/outdated
Benchmarking the AI speed and efficiency
questions.explanation: The prompt specified the purpose: 'list every time the docs were unclear/incorrect/outdated and you had to troubleshoot.'

questions.question: The tool (MCP) powering the simplified webhook filter configuration will also be used to power which other upcoming feature?
questions.explanation: JP stated: 'the same MCP tool powering it will also power the App Studio agent.'

questions.question: Which specific Farcaster HTTP endpoint did Dan Romero reference as 'no longer resolv[ing]' and referenced in older docs?
questions.explanation: DR noted: 'hoyt.farcaster.xyz (referenced in older docs) no longer resolves.'

questions.question: Dan Romero mentioned that opaque revert behavior on `KeyGateway/KeyRegistry` returned no data, requiring what action to isolate the failures?
options: Checking the global error log database
Changing the RPC provider to a premium tier
questions.explanation: DR stated it 'Required manual simulation of sub-calls (validator, IdRegistry) to isolate failures.'

questions.question: In his January 2026 posts, Dan Romero announced his plan to unfollow everyone and slowly rebuild his follow graph. What was his reasoning?
options: To find new bots and agents
To focus on niche developer APIs
questions.explanation: DR stated: 'Planning to unfollow everyone and rebuild my follow graph slowly.' The implication is curation, not a specific technical reason.

questions.question: Which specific company did Brian Armstrong repeatedly thank for sending him a 'beep' in January 2026?
questions.explanation: BA thanked @loground on 2026-01-23.

questions.question: What product update category did Jesse Pollak announce 'Just in time' for the holidays?
questions.explanation: JP announced: 'Just in time App Studio updates for you to build something over the holidays ü™ê'

questions.question: What specific feature was added to the Node.js SDK documentation that allows users to quickly jump between the function page and API reference?
questions.explanation: The post mentioned 'an easy 'Try it now' experience' linking the pages.

questions.question: According to the cited Anthropic report, how much did AI agent exploit revenue increase from March 2025 until the report date?
questions.explanation: The report noted a leap 'from $5,000 to $4.6 million in total exploit revenue.'

questions.question: What kind of media coverage was compared to 'crypto reporting of today' in a Base official post from 2022?
questions.explanation: The post referred to 'how early media coverage of the internet revolution compares to that of crypto reporting of today.'

questions.question: Brian Armstrong made a reference to a religious confession ('forgive me father, for i have beeped') while interacting with which application?
questions.explanation: The post followed a series of posts mentioning Beep.works and asking for beeps.

questions.question: The Coinbase user (Mircea Pasoi) stated they had built an incomplete Python port of which Farcaster component to better understand how it works?
questions.explanation: The user built a Python port of '@farcaster/hub-nodejs'.

questions.question: In his troubleshooting notes, Dan Romero found that the Snapchain endpoints (like Bootstrap node IPs and crackle) required what undocumented security requirement?
questions.explanation: DR noted: 'Bootstrap node IPs and crackle reject plain HTTP (‚ÄúClient sent an HTTP request to an HTTPS server‚Äù). This requirement is undocumented.'

questions.question: What was the specified reward amount for Dan Romero's 'gm' cast script bounty?
questions.explanation: Bounty: '$100 in USDC'

questions.question: During his Claude Code debugging, Dan Romero noted that which specific address/validator was rejected due to EIP-55 checksum issues?
questions.explanation: DR stated 'viem rejected the SignedKeyRequestValidator address due to incorrect mixed-case checksum'.

questions.question: What was the status of the 'dev container' that Jesse Pollak hoped to achieve following the January 23rd update to Neynar Studio?
questions.explanation: The goal was 'faster availability for the dev container (goal is to get to always ready)'

questions.question: What action did the Coinbase account announce in October 2023 regarding the 'Farcaster Is Open For Everyone' collectible?
questions.explanation: The post states: 'I just minted Farcaster Is Open For Everyone'.

questions.question: Dan Romero suggested using a specific prompt for which AI tool to help generate improvements for API documentation?
questions.explanation: The prompt was found 'to be a useful prompt at the end of a Claude Code session'.

questions.question: Which specific Farcaster infrastructure components did Dan Romero note returned 'opaque revert behavior' (no error data)?
options: The Neynar API and dev portal
questions.explanation: DR stated: 'KeyGateway/KeyRegistry reverts return no data (‚Äúexecution reverted‚Äù).'

questions.question: In his January posts, Brian Armstrong requested which bot to 'rate my undies'?
questions.explanation: BA posted: 'rate my undies @robot'

questions.question: What percentage of 'top Clanker tokens' did Jesse Pollak claim to own on a mini app on December 9th, 2025?
questions.explanation: JP stated: 'I have 4/12 top Clanker tokens.'

questions.question: What product update did Jesse Pollak refer to as 'the most joyful feature requests'?
options: The ones requested by community leaders
The ones that involve scaling architecture
The ones implemented by AI agents
questions.explanation: JP stated: 'the most joyful feature requests are the ones we've already shipped'

questions.question: What 'easy experience' was included in the automated Node.js SDK documentation alongside the relevant API reference page?
options: A link back to the SDK page for an easy 'Try it now' experience
A button to connect to a free RPC
questions.explanation: The documentation links 'back to the SDK page for an easy 'Try it now' experience.'

questions.question: Dan Romero mentioned that he had to inspect the `docker-compose bootstrap config` to eventually find the IP for which Farcaster component?
questions.explanation: He eventually discovered 'crackle.farcaster.xyz:3381 via the Snapchain writing guide' after inspecting docker-compose to find IPs.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong requested which image generation AI tool to create a 'full body image of me sitting on the other side of this confessional, sharing my deepest darkest thoughts with the Dino priest'?
questions.explanation: BA tagged '@tryemerge make a full body image of me...' in the post.

questions.question: What news source did Dan Romero link on January 24th, 2026, regarding 'Exodus - The largest wealth flight'?
questions.explanation: DR linked to 'https://www.piratewires.com/p/exodus-the-largest-wealth-flight'.

questions.question: Dan Romero noted a 'sudden uptick in obvious (?) spam' in his inbox, linking an article suggesting which specific email filter was broken?
questions.explanation: DR linked a Verge article titled 'Gmail‚Äôs spam filter broken'.

questions.question: What was the noted market order spread percentage for BTC/USD or BTC/USDC pairs on Coinbase Advanced, according to Jesse Pollak?
questions.explanation: JP stated: 'coinbase advanced is at 1%'
